verses.roman:
rāmānanda hailā prabhura virahe vihvala
prabhura dhyāne rahe viṣaya chāḍiyā sakala

synonyms: rāmānanda—Śrīla Rāmānanda Rāya; hailā—became; prabhura—of Lord Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu; virahe—in separation; vihvala—overwhelmed; prabhura dhyāne—in meditation on Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu; rahe—remains; viṣaya—worldly business; chāḍiyā—giving up; sakala—all.
translation: When Rāmānanda Rāya began to feel separation from Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu, he was overwhelmed. Meditating on the Lord, he gave up all his material business.
